job.title: Machine Learning Engineer - Remote
job.description: Machine Learning Engineer We are extremely excited to be working with a rapidly growing, truly innovative data analytics technology developer who have grown from a team of four to over one hundred employees in five years. They are continuing their expansion on the back of a number of successful projects and securing major global partnership, and are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to help drive the company's capabilities forward. This is a truly amazing opportunity for a Machine Learning Engineer to join an organisation that is destined for great things. As the selected Machine Learning Engineer your skills and experience should include: Industry experience developing machine and deep learning algorithms. A strong understanding of the auxiliary practical concerns in production machine learning systems. Solid programming skills in languages such as Python, C/C++. Experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g. Pytorch, TensorFlow, Kubeflow etc.) Proven experience of end-to-end full software development life cycle and best practice methodologies, including (but not limited to) Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban etc.), building & maintaining CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Github actions). Ideally some experience or knowledge of cloud services, data pipelines, and/or distributed ML (e.g.using docker, Kubernetes etc.) Please note: even if you don't have exactly the background indicated, do contact us now if this type of job is of interest - we may well have similar opportunities that you would be suited to. And of course, we always get your permission before submitting your CV to a company.
